text: The 2011 Barcelona Open Banco Sabadell (also known as the Torneo Godó) was a tennis tournament played on outdoor clay courts. It was the 59th edition of the event known this year as the Barcelona Open Banco Sabadell, and was part of the ATP World Tour 500 series of the 2011 ATP World Tour. It took place at the Real Club de Tenis Barcelona in Barcelona, Spain, from April 16 through April 24, 2011. The defending champion was Fernando Verdasco, but was absent from the tournament in 2011. ==Points and prize money== ===Points=== {|class=wikitable style=text-align:center;font-weight:bold !width=150|Stage !width=200|Men's Singles !width=200|Men's Doubles |- !Champion |colspan=2|500 |- !Runner up |colspan=2|300 |- !Semifinals |colspan=2|180 |- !Quarterfinals |colspan=2|90 |- !Round of 16 |colspan=2|45 |- !Round of 32 |20||0 |- !Round of 64 |0||rowspan=3|– |- !Qualifier |10 |- !Qualifying Final Round |4 |} ===Prize Money=== The Barcelona Open Banc Sabadell has slightly raised the prize money for this year’s edition, which turns it into one of the highest paid tennis tournaments in its category. The singles winner will go home with €290,000 (€4,000 more than last year). {| class=wikitable |- bgcolor=#d1e4fd ! width=150|Stage ! width=200|Men's Singles (€) ! style="width:200px;"|Men's Doubles (per team) (€) |- style=text-align:center ! Champion | 290,000 || 90,750 |- style=text-align:center ! David Ferrer, 6–2, 6–4 *It was Nadal's 2nd title of the year and 45th of his career. It was his 6th title at Barcelona, also winning from 2005–2009. ===Doubles=== Santiago González / Scott Lipsky def. Bob Bryan / Mike Bryan, 5–7, 6–2, [12–10] == References == == External links == *Official Website Barcelona Open Banco Sabadell Category:2011 in Catalan sport Bar
